text.0: the chanters hymn thee they who say the word of praise magnify thee.
text.1: the priests have raised thee up on high o Śatakratu like a pole.
text.2: as up he clomb from ridge to ridge and looked upon the toilsome task.
text.3: indra observes this wish of his and the rain hastens with his troop.
text.4: harness thy pair of strong bay steeds longmaned whose bodies fill the girths.
text.5: and indra somadrinker come to listen to our songs of praise.
text.6: come hither answer thou the song sing in approval cry aloud.
text.7: good indra make our prayer succeed and prosper this our sacrifice.
text.8: to indra must a laud be said to strengthen him who freely gives.
text.9: that Śakra may take pleasure in our friendship and drinkofferings.
text.10: him him we seek for friendship him for riches and heroic might.
text.11: for indra he is Śakra he shall aid us while he gives us wealth.
text.12: easy to turn and drive away indra is spoil bestowed by thee.
text.13: unclose the stable of the kine and give us wealth o thunderarmed.
text.14: the heaven and earth contain thee not together in thy wrathful mood.
text.15: win us the waters of the sky and send us kine abundantly.
text.16: hear thou whose ear is quick my call take to thee readily my songs.
text.17: o indra let this laud of mine come nearer even than thy friend.
text.18: we know thee mightiest of all in battles hearer of our cry.
text.19: of thee most mighty we invoke the aid that giveth thousandfold.
text.20: o indra son of kuśika drink our libation with delight.
text.21: prolong our life anew and cause the seer to win a thousand gifts.
text.22: lover of song may these our songs on every side encompass thee.
text.23: strengthening thee of lengthened life may they be dear delights to thee.
